Name: CERT C Secure Coding Standard (2008) Chapter 13 - Error Handling (ERR)
Summary: Weaknesses in this category are related to the rules and recommendations in the Error Handling (ERR) chapter of the CERT C Secure Coding Standard (2008).

References.Title: The CERT C Secure Coding Standard

MappingNotes.Rationale: This entry is a Category. Using categories for mapping has been discouraged since 2019. Categories are informal organizational groupings of weaknesses that can help CWE users with data aggregation, navigation, and browsing. However, they are not weaknesses in themselves.
MappingNotes.Comments: See member weaknesses of this category.

Notes.Note:
<xhtml:p>In the 2008 version of the CERT C Secure Coding standard, the following rules were mapped to the following CWE IDs:</xhtml:p>
                  <xhtml:ul>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-20 ERR07-C Prefer functions that support error checking over equivalent functions that don't</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-391 ERR00-C Adopt and implement a consistent and comprehensive error-handling policy</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-544 ERR00-C Adopt and implement a consistent and comprehensive error-handling policy</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-676 ERR07-C Prefer functions that support error checking over equivalent functions that don't</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-705 ERR04-C Choose an appropriate termination strategy</xhtml:li>
                  </xhtml:ul>
